title: The NFL playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: The 2025 NFL playoff field is set, and an exciting wild-card round looms. Here's everything to know about the 14 teams vying to win Super Bowl LX.

title: NFL wild-card round: Rams huge favorites; Packers, Bills, Texans road favorites
content: The NFL playoffs are set. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every game in the wild-card round.

title: Falcons fire Morris, Fontenot despite hot finish
content: The Falcons have fired coach Raheem Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot after two straight disappointing seasons.

title: Johnson rips Bears' offense after loss to Lions
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson wasn't happy with his team's offense in a 19-16 loss to the Lions while QB Caleb Williams admitted Chicago came out "flat."

title: QB Sorsby, top player in portal, commits to TTU
content: Former Cincinnati quarterback Brendan Sorsby, the top player in the NCAA transfer portal, is committing to Texas Tech, he told ESPN.

title: Rodgers fulfills Steelers' 'vision,' delivers AFC North
content: The Steelers placed their belief in Aaron Rodgers in the offseason. On Sunday night, the veteran QB showed why they were right to do so, leading Pittsburgh to a 26-24 win over Baltimore and the AFC North crown.

title: Becht rejoins Campbell, transfers to Penn State
content: Former Iowa State standout Rocco Becht, one of the most coveted quarterbacks in the NCAA transfer portal, committed to Penn State, he told ESPN in a phone interview Sunday, a program that will allow him to continue to play for coach Matt Campbell.

title: Eagles stand by rest call despite losing 2-seed
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni stood by the decision to rest most of his starters in a Week 18 loss to the Commanders despite it costing Philadelphia a chance for the No. 2 seed.

title: Booker hands OKC rare loss with game-winning 3
content: Suns star Devin Booker drained a step-back 3-pointer with 0.7 seconds left to hand the Thunder their sixth loss this season.

title: ✍ 2026 NFL draft order: First 18 slots are set
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order -- plus each team's top need -- after the regular season.

title: Steelers escape Ravens' late push, win AFC North title
content: In a rock fight that morphed into a fourth-quarter track meet, Pittsburgh edges Baltimore to advance.

title: Barnwell makes his NFL award picks: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Drake Maye or Matthew Stafford for MVP? Which rookies should earn hardware? And no one is beating out Myles Garrett for DPOY, right?

title: We answered seven questions about the Falcons' coaching, GM moves
content: Even a four-game win streak to end the season couldn't stop the firings, so where do the Falcons turn now?

title: Sack records: Garrett makes history; Broncos' D four shy of team record
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher breaks the single-season sack record, and the Broncos' defense comes up short.

title: Unpacking Man City-Chelsea, Joan Garcia stars for Barca, Amorim out at Man United
content: Man City might think they "controlled" Sunday's draw with Chelsea, but dropped points is all that matters. Plus: Joan Garcia is superb for Barça against his old club as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: 'Fragile' no more: How the Bears' Caleb Williams, Ben Johnson evolved
content: Caleb Williams thought Ben Johnson didn't like him at one point, but the duo evolved to lead the playoff-bound Bears.

title: MVP, ROY, All-NBA teams and more: Predictions for all the league's highest honors
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton projects the favorites to win each award and make the All-NBA teams, as well as other contenders and long shots.

title: NBA insiders predict 2026: Why LeBron, trade sagas, expansion news could rock the league
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the stars, sagas and storylines that will dominate 2026.

title: NHL's best this week: Who wins a series between U.S.-Canada Olympic B-teams?
content: Many superstars were left off the rosters. Here's how two teams of snubs look -- and who would win a seven-game series.

title: VAR review: Why was Wirtz onside in Premier League, offside in Europe?
content: Liverpool had a goal from Florian Wirtz ruled out vs. Fulham, but it was overturned by VAR on the slimmest of margins. Why?

title: VAR doesn't interfere with second yellow cards. But should it?
content: Despite some major incidents lately, VAR is unable to get involved in second yellow cards. Here's why.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: Fantasy football year in review: 2025 takeaways and a look ahead to 2026
content: A summary of the best fantasy performances, biggest storylines, surprises and disappointments, along with the usual dose of historical perspective.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid join chase for Wharton
content: Real Madrid have joined the race for Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Make these fights, UFC: Makhachev-Topuria, Jones-Pereira and more
content: From superfights to title rematches to downright epics, these 10 matchups need to be booked this year.

title: US VP's house attacked: Windows smashed; Secret Service swarms Ohio residence, 1 held
content: The home of US Vice President JD Vance in Cincinnati faced an attack in early hours of Monday. Several windows were smashed at his residence. The Secret Service and local police responded swiftly. A person has been taken into custody following the incident. Authorities are investigating the matter. Vance's office stated security concerns influence his and the President's co-location.

title: Rahul vs Priyanka? Will Cong's Assam move change party leadership dynamics?
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's appointment as chairperson of the Assam election screening committee fuels leadership debate, with the BJP alleging internal conflict between her and Rahul Gandhi. The Congress dismisses these claims, asserting her experience and organizational capabilities. This move, amidst whispers of her potential elevation, comes as the party seeks to regain ground in Assam.

title: H-1B staff in India face coding ban; policy to run till March 2026
content: Amazon is allowing tech workers stranded in India due to H-1B visa delays to work remotely until March 2026. However, severe restrictions ban coding, testing, strategic decisions, and customer interactions, leaving many unable to perform their core job functions. This policy addresses visa backlogs, impacting thousands of employees.

title: Trump flips Monroe into Donroe: How US plans to reshape the Western Hemisphere — explained
content: US President Donald Trump has revived and expanded the Monroe Doctrine, now dubbed the "Donroe Doctrine," to assert American dominance across the Western Hemisphere. This aggressive approach has led to military action in Venezuela, threats against Cuba and Colombia, and ambitions for Greenland, signaling a significant shift in US foreign policy.

title: Last-minute call? Kohli to miss Delhi’s Vijay Hazare match tomorrow
content: Star batter Virat Kohli has withdrawn from Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Railways, a decision confirmed by Delhi coach Sarandeep Singh. Kohli had previously met the BCCI mandate by playing two games, scoring impressively. His absence means he won't face pacer Himanshu Sangwan before joining the India squad for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Quote of the day Epicurus: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring…”
content: Ancient Greek philosopher Epicurus, founder of "The Garden," advocated for moderation and clear-headedness, not indulgence. He believed true pleasure lies in the absence of pain and worry, achieved by recognizing and being satisfied with life's simpler joys.

title: ‘Ab yahi zindagi hai’: Umar Khalid reacts after SC denies bail; partner shares brief chat
content: Umar Khalid, denied bail by the Supreme Court in the 2020 Delhi riots case, stated prison is now his life. While he expressed happiness for co-accused granted bail, the court found a prima facie case against him under UAPA. The Supreme Court also noted that trial delays don't automatically override UAPA safeguards.

title: Mark Cuban on AI in education: Urges students to boost critical thinking
content: Shark Tank investor Mark Cuban advises students to use AI to enhance critical thinking, not replace it. He believes AI can help students produce better, more creative work and gain essential future workplace skills. Cuban also highlighted access to AI tools as a major barrier for effective and ethical education.

title: 'Unlucky to miss out': AB de Villiers explains why India ignored this star player
content: Former Proteas star AB de Villiers believes Mohammed Siraj's T20 World Cup snub stems from team balance, not form.  He highlighted India's preference for all-rounders like Harshit Rana and a spin-heavy strategy, seeing Siraj as unlucky but crucial for future ODI plans.  De Villiers feels India's bowling depth covers all bases for championship success.

title: Andrew McCutchen & Maria Hanslovan net worth: MLB earnings, contracts and assets
content: Andrew McCutchen's stellar MLB career, marked by five All-Star selections and an MVP award, has been the bedrock of his substantial finances, amassing over $131 million from contracts. His wife, Maria Hanslovan, contributes significantly through her thriving fitness and wellness career. Together, their combined net worth is estimated between $60-$65 million, bolstered by endorsements and joint assets.

title: SpaceX starts 2026 with an important launch: Italy’s new eye in orbit
content: SpaceX kicked off 2026 with a successful launch of Italy's COSMO SkyMed Second Generation satellite from California. This radar observation satellite, designed for both civilian and military use, highlights Italy's ongoing space program and SpaceX's reliable service. The mission, despite minor delays, underscores SpaceX's commitment to international partnerships and its role as a dependable launch provider.

title: Rs 79,000 crore defence push: How India is rearming to counter China and Pakistan
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council approved nearly Rs 79,000 crore in military modernization projects, including air defense missiles, combat drones, and long-range rockets. These crucial acquisitions aim to bolster operational readiness against evolving threats from China and Pakistan, emphasizing speed, precision, and multi-domain warfare capabilities.

title: 'Don't play games': US issues blunt warning to Iran; calls US Prez 'man of action'
content: The US State Department issued a stern warning to Iran's leadership, emphasizing President Trump's readiness to act as nationwide unrest escalates.  Trump vowed to 'rescue' protesters if Iranian forces use deadly force, stating the US is 'locked and loaded.'  Demonstrations, fueled by economic woes and civil disobedience, feature chants against the regime.

title: On This Day: The accidental birth of limited-over cricket at the MCG
content: Fifty-five years ago, a rain-hit Test match unexpectedly birthed One-Day International cricket. England posted 190, and Australia, chasing 191, secured a five-wicket victory at the MCG. This accidental innovation, witnessed by 46,000 fans, paved the way for the World Cup and revolutionised the sport, leading to today's T20 era.

title: No more 3-4-3: Manchester United sack head coach Ruben Amorim; here's why
content: The 1-1 draw at Elland Road was Amorim’s final match of his 14-month spell in charge. The result left Manchester United sixth in the Premier League after 20 matches.

title: SIR showdown: Mamata to move SC against 'inhumane treatment' of people
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced plans to approach the Supreme Court, citing "inhumane" conduct during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. She alleged fear, harassment, and administrative arbitrariness led to deaths and hospitalizations, with names being arbitrarily struck off. Banerjee criticized the process as "unplanned, arbitrary and adhoc," urging its halt to prevent voter disenfranchisement.

title: Trump's fresh tariff threat: Will stopping Russian oil imports ease US pressure on India?
content: Donald Trump has stepped up trade pressure on India, with the US President threatening higher tariffs over continued Russian oil purchases even as Indian exports already face steep duties.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office: Ranveer starrer to see drop on 5th weekend post historic run
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its record-breaking run, completing a month in cinemas and outperforming newer releases. The film amassed approximately Rs 33.25 crore over its fifth weekend, pushing its total collection to an impressive Rs 772.87 crore. It now sets its sights on breaking the record held by 'Pushpa 2'.

title: Delhi man beaten, wife molested, son stripped and thrashed in full public view
content: A dispute over a residential gym in Laxmi Nagar led to a violent assault on January 2. The gym's caretaker allegedly attacked the owner, molested his wife, and stripped and beat their son on the street. Police have arrested the main accused, while three others remain at large.

title: 'Their action same as Kasab': Giriraj Singh on Umar, Sharjeel's bail denial
content: Union minister Giriraj Singh equated Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam's actions to those of terrorist Kasab, following the Supreme Court's denial of their bail in the 2020 Delhi riots case. The BJP welcomed the verdict, asserting the riots were organized and sponsored, not spontaneous. Khalid, denied bail, stated jail is now his life.

title: Ravens fans spam rookie kicker Tyler Loop after season-ending missed field goal
content: Baltimore Ravens rookie kicker Tyler Loop faced severe backlash on his engagement announcement post after a season-ending loss. Fans flooded his Instagram comments with hateful messages, prompting sports media personality Dov Kleiman to condemn the behavior. Many users defended Loop, pointing out the team's overall underperformance and the defense's role in the loss.

title: Shooters walked in, fired, and vanished: AAP sarpanch killed in Punjab - video
content: An AAP sarpanch, Jarmal Singh, was shot dead at a wedding venue in Amritsar by two gunmen. The brazen attack, captured on CCTV, saw the assailants approach and fire a single shot to his head before fleeing. Gangsters have claimed responsibility for the premeditated killing.

title: Campus forecast 2026: How agentic AI could change the way universities run
content: Higher education is entering a second AI phase—one where systems stop merely assisting and start acting. A new UPCEA report predicts the rise of agentic AI by 2026: tools that can plan, execute, and manage work across campus systems. The promise is efficiency. The challenge is governance. The real question is not speed—but control.

title: Mustafizur Rahman row: Bangladesh government imposes indefinite IPL telecast ban
content: Bangladesh has indefinitely banned all Indian Premier League broadcasts and promotions. This drastic step follows the removal of Bangladeshi bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the Kolkata Knight Riders squad, a move the government deems inexplicable and angering to its citizens.

title: 'Delay no trump card': SC rejects bail for Khalid, Imam in Delhi riots case — what the court said
content: The Supreme Court denied bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, citing a prima facie case under UAPA. The court found they played a "formative role" in the conspiracy. However, five other accused were granted bail with strict conditions. Khalid and Imam can seek bail again after one year.

title: Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit sparks row: B'desh says no to T20 WC in India; ball in ICC's court
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has decided not to send its team to India for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, citing security concerns. Following Mustafizur Rahman’s IPL exit, the BCB has requested the ICC to shift Bangladesh’s matches to Sri Lanka. The global body stares at a logistical nightmare before the multi-nation event.

title: US says India sought relief from 25% tariffs, claims New Delhi 'buying less Russian oil'
content: India has requested the United States to remove additional tariffs. This comes after India reduced its purchases of Russian oil. US President Donald Trump had previously imposed these duties. Trade tensions persist between the two nations. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Trump have discussed trade matters. India maintains its stance on energy security.

title: 'Make in India' Apple iPhone exports hit milestone! $50 bn mark crossed under PLI scheme
content: Apple's manufacturing in India has propelled iPhone exports past $50 billion within the PLI scheme, significantly outpacing rival Samsung. This surge, driven by five manufacturing units and a robust supplier network, positions smartphones as India's top export item, with continued government support planned for the sector.

title: UP Board exam 2026 pre-board schedule released; exams from January 8 to 21
content: The UP Board has released the pre-board schedule for 2026, with exams for Class 10 and 12 students running from January 8 to 21. All government, aided, and unaided schools will follow the same timetable. Schools must complete the syllabus, conduct written and practical exams, and upload internal assessment marks. Pre-board exams provide students a realistic experience of the main board exams. Practical exams will be held in two phases, and the main exams start February 18.

title: Fans misbehave with Rohit Sharma; Hitman responds — WATCH
content: The year 2025 was remarkable for Rohit Sharma. He not only amassed huge scores but also broke several records, including becoming the top-ranked ODI batter in the ICC rankings for the first time. He also reached the milestone of 20,000 international runs and led India to ICC Champions Trophy glory.

title: Gold price today: How much the yellow metal costs in your city; check rates
content: Gold prices surged on Monday, recovering from last week's decline. February gold futures on MCX rose by Rs 1,509, reaching Rs 1,37,270 per 10 grams. This rebound was driven by geopolitical concerns in Venezuela and anticipation of US economic data, with global Comex futures also seeing a significant gain.

title: Indore deaths: Waterborne outbreak declared epidemic; supply shut, chlorination underway
content: Indore's health administration has declared a waterborne disease outbreak in Bhagirathpura an epidemic after 10 deaths. Specialized teams from central and state governments are investigating the contamination source. A high-level meeting was held to coordinate efforts with national and state experts.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside the private life of Aaron Rodgers’ wife
content: Aaron Rodgers, the NFL veteran, has been involved in a lot of messy public relationships but now, he has declared himself to be a married man. It has been more than six months since Aaron Rodgers has revealed he is married but his wife, Brittani, has stayed out of the spotlight. While this has sparked chaos, here's everything known about Brittani.

title: Dwayne Bravo reveals MS Dhoni's on-field leadership masterclass
content: Dwayne Bravo revealed MS Dhoni's astute man-management, recalling an instance where Dhoni advised him against diving to field, emphasizing his bowling value over saving runs. This insight highlights Dhoni's ability to leverage players' strengths, fostering trust and a consistent team culture. Bravo felt Dhoni valued his specific contributions, leading to greater confidence on the field.

title: CMC launches Animal Birth Control programme for stray dogs in Yadgir
content: In keeping with the Supreme Court guidelines, a team of doctors is carrying out neutering and spaying surgery at the veterinary hospital

title: When the Carnatic Trinity takes the stage
content: A play on the trio will premiere on January 9 at Vani Mahal as part of Thyaga Brahma Gana Sabha’s 80th year celebration

title: Indian statement on U.S. action in Venezuela unworthy: CPI-M
content: In a statement, the CPI(M) says there was not a word of condemnation about the "gross violation" of the United Nations Charter and international law in India's statement

title: Three-day Millet Mela to commence on January 8 at Anantapur
content: Stalls will be set up by 18 NGOs to create awareness and motivate farmers to take up natural/organic farming and grow millets along with other food crops, say organisers

title: Naidu calls for Telugu unity, river interlinking at World Mahasabhalu
content: The Chief Minister stresses cooperation between Telugu States on water sharing and language promotion, and announces a Telugu University in Rajamahendravaram

title: Pala political landscape heats up ahead of Assembly elections
content: With current MLA Mani C. Kappan firmly staking his claim to the seat and Mani ramping up his campaign efforts, the stage is set for a potential triangular contest that could include BJP State vice-president Shaun George.

title: Minister lays foundation stone for Kidwai cancer unit in Raichur
content: The State govt. is planning to establish cancer and superspeciality hospitals in each district to extend universal health coverage

title: Chair hurled at Somanna during foundation stone-laying ceremony in Koppal
content: Hitnal village witnesses disturbance for some time as a group of Congress workers protests following a row over protocol

title: Ahead of T.N. Assembly polls, Congress MP calls for sharing of power, not just seats
content: No party can win the Assembly polls in Tamil Nadu without the support of alliance parties, says B. Manickam Tagore

title: Opposition questions denial of bail to Umar, Sharjeel; flags Gurmeet Ram Rahim's 15th parole
content: The CPI(M) said in a post on X that the continued denial of bail is against the principles of natural justice; the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) is being used to crush dissent, it charged

title: I never deviated from party line: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor
content: He said controversies often arise when media reports are based only on headlines without reading the full content

title: Injured tiger dies in the Nilgiris
content: Forest department officials said the animal was found with injuries with those caused due to in-fighting, most likely sustained in a fight with another tiger.

title: What Kavitha said before announcing a political party in Telangana
content: In an emotional address in the Legislative Council, where she also broke down, she accused the BRS of suspending her without an opportunity to explain her stand

title: BMC chief admits mistake in deploying court staff for poll duty; gets High Court rap
content: The entire controversy began in late December 2025, when the Commissioner, acting as the District Election Officer, issued letters ordering staff from Mumbai's subordinate courts to report for election duty despite High Court’s administrative decision to exempt court staff.

title: Karnataka MLA Laxman Savadi, his son, and followers booked for assault of DCC bank worker
content: As per the FIR, Mr. Savadi accused Ningaraj Karennavar of orchestrating the transfer of a DCC bank employee who was related to the MLA, abused him, and slapped him at the MLA‘s residence in Athani on January 3, 2026.

title: Delhi blast: Court sends Yasir Ahmed Dar to 11-day judicial custody
content: Principal District and Sessions Judge Anju Bajaj Chandna sent Dar to the judicial custody till January 16 after he was physically produced in the court

title: KSRTC cuts fares on premium services to boost off-season travel
content: KSRTC typically increases fares on premium services by 10–15% during peak travel periods, such as April to June and October to December, when passenger demand is high.

title: Longest tenure as Chief Minister with ‘people’s blessings’: Siddaramaiah
content: However, the Chief Minister added that records are meant to be broken, and that another leader who could surpass his tenure may emerge in the future.

title: Mamata says she will move court on January 6 against 'inhumane' conduct of SIR
content: "If allowed, I will also move the Supreme Court and plead as a common person against this inhumane exercise," says Mamata Banerjee

title: Call for quality audit gains momentum as defects surface on NH in Kozhikode
content: Demand follows a series of incidents that have put the quality and safety of ongoing construction work under serious public scrutiny

title: A ‘terrorist act’ is not just the finale, but the build-up of conspiracy and abetment too: Supreme Court judgment in Delhi riots case
content: A ‘terrorist act’ under the UAPA extended to disruption of essential supplies leading to economic insecurity and destabilisation of civic life even if violence was not committed in the process, the court said

title: BJP expels 22 workers for anti-party activities in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar
content: According to party sources, of the expelled workers, 11 have joined the Shiv Sena and got candidature to contest in the civic election

title: Karnataka Development Programme meeting disrupted after clash between BJP MLA and Congress MLC in Bidar
content: The quarterly Karnataka Development Programme (KDP) review meeting chaired by Forest and Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre in Bidar on Monday was disrupted following a heated argument between BJP MLA Siddu Patil and Congress MLC Bhimarao Patil over a layout related issue.

title: Saraswati idols vandalised in Bengal's Purba Medinipur, alleges Suvendu
content: The West Bengal Assembly Leader of Opposition accuses the police administration of failing to take exemplary action against those responsible, which, he claims, had led to a rise in such cases

title: Telangana Government rules out administrative and financial motives behind GHMC trifurcation
content: Minister Sridhar Babu criticises BRS for indulging in indiscriminate borrowings of ₹6,401 crore with higher interest rates

title: Jail is my life now; happy for others who got bail: Umar Khalid after SC denies bail
content: "I am really happy for the others, who got bail! so relieved”, activist Umar Khalid told his partner Banojyotsna Lahiri on January 5 after the Supreme Court ruling

title: Supreme Court develops ‘hierarchy of culpability’ to justify no bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, but bail to others in Delhi riots case
content: 'Treating all the accused identically will risk transforming pre-trial detention into a punitive mechanism divorced from individual circumstances. Prolonged custody disproportionately burdens those whose roles are limited,' apex court says

title: National Turmeric Board regional office, testing lab to come up in Erode: Union Minister
content: On the demand for developing new turmeric varieties with high curcumin content, Union Minister for Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Shivraj Singh Chouhan said ICAR would work on it

title: Steps initiated to deploy eight MRI and CT machines each by end of March 2026: Telangana Health Minister
content: Damodar Raja Narasimha says LINAC machine, Brachytherapy machines and 15 ventilators too are being procured for Telangana government hospitals

title: Seven CPI(M) workers booked over alleged attack on BJP activists in Kerala’s Kannur
content: According to the complaint by two BJP workers, the attack was politically motivated, stemming from resentment over recent local body election results

title: Three arrested for tying elderly woman to a tree, assaulting her in Krishnagiri
content: The incident came to light after a video of the assault was circulated on social media, leading to police action

title: Polavaram-Nallamala project opposed by Maharashtra and Karnataka too: Telangana Irrigation Minister
content: The Apex court, he said, has adjourned the case on the subject to next Monday and suggested that the matter be pursued through a suit petition rather than a writ petition; the State will seek a stay on the project during the next hearing, the Minister for Irrigation said

title: Naidu’s many visions: ₹100-crore for quantum Nobel sets aspirations, spotlights capacity constraints
content: AP CM Chandrababu Naidu’s announcement sits at the intersection of educational investment, particularly research funding, laboratories, and scientific infrastructure, and the technology-led industrial transformation that the State government is betting on to shape Amaravati’s future.

title: Punarjani scheme promoters Manappat Foundation faces legal scrutiny in Kerala over alleged FCRA violations
content: Officials say Kerala government is legally examining VACB report to Home department in 2025 which stated that the NGO violated Rule 19 of FCRA by allegedly failing to maintain records of foreign donations for Punarjani project and of utilisation of endowments from abroad

title: Visakh Refinery’s residue upgradation facility is a major milestone for A.P., says CM
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu announces the launch of HPCL Visakh Refinery’s brand-new Residue Upgradation Facility (RUF), expected to boost local fuel supplies and spark socio-economic growth

title: Republic Day 2026: Ticket sales begin for Republic Day parade and Beating the Retreat — prices, dates, and booking details
content: Book your tickets for the Republic Day Parade and Beating the Retreat 2026 online or offline before January 14

title: Tiger census gets under way in Karnataka
content: The 2026 census is the sixth such exercise with earlier the enumeration conducted in 2006, 2010, 2014, 2018 and 2022.

title: BMC polls: JD(S) withdraws complaint; former MP Rathod to pursue fight against speaker Narwekar
content: Various Opposition parties have accused Narwekar of violating the model code of conduct in force for civic polls, interfering in nomination process and tampering with CCTV footage linked to the exercise

title: Delhi riots case: Delay cannot be used as a ‘trump card’ to secure bail, SC reasons
content: Supreme Court reasoned that constitutional guarantees of personal liberty and life are not “absolute” or “unregulated”, but subject to restrictions on bail under special statutes like the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act

title: Patrons frown at Railway Ministry’s move to extend Bengaluru-Kannur express via Mangalutu to Kozhikode
content: Long-distance connectivity needs beyond Kannur should be addressed by separate services, not by overburdening an already saturated train

title: Kavitha says she will form political party in Telangana
content: Breaking down while speaking about the restrictions on her within the BRS following Bathukamma programme held after formation of the State, Ms. Kavitha said she did not receive support from party mouthpieces for her programmes

title: Bengali actor Dev, three family members, get SIR hearing notice from ECI
content: Leaders of the ruling Trinamool Congress said issuing such a notice to a busy film actor, who is also an MP, amounted to harassment

title: Juvenile caught for filming inside women’s washroom at Bengaluru movie theatre
content: Based on a complaint filed by the affected women, the juvenile and his mobile phone were taken into custody for further investigation.

title: Teenage boy injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: The incident occurred in the morning at a forest in Lendra-Korcholi under Gangaloor police station limits when the victim, a resident of Korcholi village, had gone there, police said

title: On 15th parole, Gurmeet Ram Rahim walks out of prison; to stay at Sirsa Dera
content: Gurmeet Singh will stay at his Sirsa-headquartered Dera during the 40-day period, said Dera spokesperson and advocate Jitender Khurana

title: Indore water contamination: Official suspended over reference to ‘ghanta’ row
content: Officials said Ujjain Division Revenue Commissioner Ashish Singh suspended the SDM on charges of serious negligence, indifference and irregularities in the discharge of official duties

title: Beer-laden lorry overturns after collision in Kerala’s Kozhikode; driver killed, bottles scattered on road
content: More than 20 police personnel have been deployed at the accident site to prevent people from taking away the beer bottles.

title: 1 killed, 2 injured as portion of building's ceiling collapses in Kolkata's Park Circus
content: Residents said several families live on rent in the building and they had repeatedly requested the owner to repair the structure, which was in a severely dilapidated condition

title: NRI couple from Palakol dies in road accident in U.S.
content: The victims Krishna Kishore and his wife, Asha, natives of Palakol in West Godavari district, had settled in the U.S. a few years ago

title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2026 Mobile Library flagged off in Chennai
content: The mobile library will begin touring the city from Monday for the benefit of readers at Thiruvanmiyur Beach, Anna Nagar Tower Park, Marina Beach, Besant Nagar Beach, IIT-Madras, Light House, and Mudhalvar Pathipaggam Perambur, among other areas

title: BJP councillor R. Sreelekha says Thiruvananthapuram Mayor’s post was promised to her, but overlooked at last minute
content: ‘But I cannot give up the councillor’s post as I have to serve the people who voted for me’, says Sreelekha

title: Madras High Court dismisses cases filed by Minister I. Periyasamy, family against ED proceedings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say, the petitioners could approach the adjudicating authority under the PMLA

title: Union Minister Manohar Lal appreciates AP’s progress in implementing energy efficiency programs
content: Manohar Lal Khattar emphasized need for States to intensify climate mitigation efforts through coordinated action involving governments, industries, institutions, and citizens, stressing that climate action cannot succeed without mass public participation

title: Supreme Court signs MoU with Bhutan apex court for exchange of law clerks, says CJI Surya Kant
content: “The initiative is aimed at strengthening judicial cooperation and enhancing institutional ties between the two countries,” says the CJI

title: Delhi riots case: Supreme Court denies bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, grants relief to five co-accused
content: The top court reasoned that Mr. Khalid and Mr. Imam stood on a “higher footing in the hierarchy of participation” in the charges levelled by the Delhi Police

title: Banks speed up response time, but technical shortcomings continue to fuel cybercrimes
content: According to data accessed by The Hindu, banks’ response time to police enquiries and notices averaged 15 to 20 days in 2024, depending on the bank. In 2025, this has come down to about a week.

title: Two injured in blasts in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: The house has remained abandoned since ethnic violence broke out in the state in May 2023, with its owner and his family currently living at a relief camp

title: IRCTC ‘scam’ case: Delhi HC asks CBI to reply to Lalu Prasad’s plea against charge framing order
content: Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma, however, refused to stay the trial, at this stage, in the case, and said it cannot do so without going through the probe agency's reply

title: Kalyan Singh's tenure as CM to be remembered for pushing nationalist mission in U.P.: Adityanath
content: Mr. Adityanath paid tributes to the former Chief Minister, fondly remembered as "Babuji", and recalled his role in restoring public confidence at a time when Uttar Pradesh was facing widespread disorder

title: Rajnath Singh commissions ICG’s pollution control vessel ‘Samudra Pratap’ in Goa
content: “The 114.5-metre vessel, built by the Goa Shipyard Limited (GSL), has over 60% of indigenous content. The 4,200-tonne vessel boasts a speed of more than 22 knots and an endurance of 6,000 nautical miles,” says officials

title: ‘People of Bengal embraced SIR as beacon of hope’: BJP's Suvendu writes to Chief Election Commissioner
content: Mr. Adhikari claimed that the CM’s call to “halt” the special intensive revision (SIR) is nothing short of an “admission of defeat”, and a “brazen attempt to perpetuate the electoral malfeasance” that has defined her tenure

title: Dialysis deaths: Medical negligence case filed against Haripad taluk hospital in Kerala
content: Two patients undergoing dialysis at the hospital on December 29 developed adverse reactions and died a day later

title: Srisailam temple management warns of action against prohibited activities in temple town
content: The warning by the temple management came in the wake of the staff of a satram organising New Year celebrations on December 31 night during which movie songs were played and the staff danced to them

title: Intense cold weather prevail at many places in Haryana, Punjab
content: At 4.5° Celsius each, Bathinda and Faridkot in Punjab also reeled under intense cold, recording similar minimum temperatures

title: Malayalam actor Kannan Pattambi, brother of filmmaker Major Ravi, dies
content: Kannan Pattambi had been an active presence in Malayalam film industry for years. He also acted in numerous television serials

title: Three minors held for pelting stones at religious procession
content: A girl who was part of the Om Shakti devotees participating in the procession sustained head injuries in the pelting of stones.

title: Three killed, ten injured as bus overturns on highway in Rajasthan
content: “An accident occurred at around 10 p.m. when the bus lost control and overturned on the highway. The cause of the accident is yet to be ascertained,” says Ahore Station House Officer

title: Indian Air Force’s Suryakiran Aerobatic Team to thrill Hyderabad skies on January 28 and 29
content: Formed in 1966, the Suryakiran Aerobatic Team is popularly known as the Ambassadors of the Indian Air Force

title: Gandhinagar typhoid surge: Amit Shah calls for swift government action
content: “Due to leakage in a water pipeline, cases of suspected typhoid, a water-borne disease, were reported in Sectors 24, 28, and Adivada area of Gandhinagar city a few days ago,” says the State Government

title: Two injured as 5.1-magnitude quake hits Assam
content: A National Centre for Seismology report said the quake was recorded at 4.17 a.m. in Morigaon district on the southern bank of Brahmaputra, at a depth of 50 km

title: Delhi riots case LIVE: Jail is my life now; happy for others who got bail, says Umar Khalid, after Supreme Court denies bail
content: The top court on Monday denied bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, while it allowed the release of five other co-accused, including Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd. Saleem Khan and Shadab Ahmad, after distinguishing their alleged roles

title: Declare Kumbh Mela area restricted zone for non-Hindus before 2027 Ardh Kumbh: Shri Ganga Sabha
content: The Sabha president said that the government should identify such people and remove them from Haridwar

title: South Korean man stabbed to death by Indian live-in partner in Greater Noida; accused held
content: The deceased was identified as Duck Hee Yuh, a South Korean, who was living at ATS Pious Hideaways in Sector 150 in Gautam Buddh Nagar district

title: Men's boxers to watch in 2026: Ryan Garcia, Jake Paul, others
content: five fighters could break through in 2026 and make a run at the top of their respective divisions . in 2025, he lost to Rolando "Rolly" Romero in may and was expelled from the WBC in July for repeatedly using racial slurs . the door is opening for a new generation to emerge .

title: Early wild card bets: How to bet Packers-Bears, Bills-Jaguars
content: the playoffs kick off with the Los Angeles Rams at the Carolina Panthers, followed by the Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears . on Sunday, the red-hot Houston Texans hit the road to face the Pittsburgh Steelers .

title: Jags resurface Sean Payton's 'small-market' comment to lead Week 18 trolls
content: Pittsburgh hung on to defeat the Baltimore Ravens 26-24 in a wild "Sunday Night Football" matchup . the Steelers miss a field goal attempt as time expires . it's the final week of the regular season, and they are already in postseason form .

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: Maduro dancing to 'No War, Yes Peace' may have triggered Trump into kidnapping him

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: 'It's pretty emotional': Rodgers' take on returning to playoffs tops Week 18 quotes
content: the Pittsburgh Steelers host the Baltimore Ravens in a win-or-go-home showdown . players and coaches carried the intensity from the field to the podium . here are some of the best quotes from around the NFL in Week 18 .

title: 2 Men Rape Hindu Widow, Tie Her To Tree And Cut Her Hair In Bangladesh
content: A 40-year-old Hindu woman has allegedly been gang-raped by two men, who also tied her to a tree and cut off her hair in central Bangladesh's Kaliganj, a sub-district of Jhenaidah.

title: Maduro, Wife At New York Court, 1st Appearance After Capture By US Forces
content: Deposed Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro arrived at a New York court on Monday, just days after being seized in Caracas in a shock US military operation that paved the path for Washington's plans to dominate the oil-rich country.

title: Fugitive Economic Offender Tag For Himachal University Promoters In In Rs 387-Crore Fake Degree Case
content: The Special PMLA Court in Shimla has declared Ashoni Kanwar and her son, Mandeep Rana, as Fugitive Economic Offenders (FEO) in connection with a multi-crore fake degree scam.

title: Kanimozhi Birthday Video Sparks Power Play Buzz Within DMK
content: DMK's parliamentary party chief and head of the party's manifesto committee for the assembly elections, Kanimozhi Karunanidhi, is keen to contest the coming elections to the Tamil Nadu legislative assembly, sources in the party have indicated.

title: Tata Group Looking For New Chiefs For Air India, Air India Express: Report
content: The Tata Group has begun scouting for a suitable candidate to head Air India, as the tenure of the incumbent, Campbell Wilson, will end next year, sources have said.

title: Illegal Betting Case: Luxury Cars Linked To YouTuber Seized By Probe Agency
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has carried out search operations at nine locations across Delhi, Mumbai, Surat, Lucknow and Varanasi on December 31, 2025 and January 1, 2026 in connection with an illegal online betting and gambling case.

title: Delhi EV Policy 2.0: Subsidy For Women, Rs 1 Lakh Incentive For 4-Wheelers
content: The Delhi government is gearing up to roll out a new Electric Vehicle (EV) Policy 2.0, aimed at fast-tracking clean mobility across the national capital.

title: Switzerland Freezes Nicolas Maduro's Assets "With Immediate Effect"
content: The Swiss government said Monday that it had decided to freeze any assets held in Switzerland by the deposed Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro or his associates "with immediate effect".

title: Ex-Indonesia Minister Charged For Corruption Over Google Laptop Procurement
content: Indonesian prosecutors on Monday filed corruption charges against former education minister and the co-founder of startup Gojek, Nadiem Makarim, over alleged improper laptop procurement during the pandemic that led to $125.64 million in state losses.

title: "Security Risk": Israel Says Gaza Media Ban Should Stay, Despite Ceasefire
content: Israeli authorities have told the Supreme Court that a ban on international media access to Gaza should remain in place, arguing it is necessary for security reasons, according to a government submission filed by the public prosecutor.

title: Iran Judiciary Chief's "No Leniency" Message For Rioters Amid Protests
content: Iran will offer no leniency to "rioters", though the public has a right to demonstrate, the head of the judiciary said on Monday, following more than a week of protests.

title: Corpses Dumped, Buried: 287 Killed During Hasina-Era Abductions
content: A Bangladesh commission investigating disappearances during the rule of ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina said Monday at least 287 people were assumed to have been killed.

title: "You Did Not Even Spare God": Supreme Court On Sabarimala Gold Theft Case
content: KP Shankardas, a former member of the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), has suffered a setback in the Supreme Court, which refused to expunge remarks made by the Kerala High Court in the Sabarimala gold theft case.

title: 2 Injured In Blast In Manipur's Bishnupur, Villagers Protest 'Inaction'
content: Two people were injured when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted near an abandoned house of a Meitei family in Manipur's Bishnupur district went off this morning, officials said.

title: "This Is My Life Now": What Umar Khalid Told Partner After He Was Denied Bail
content: Shortly after another door was closed to him after spending five years in jail, activist and former JNU student Umar Khalid remarked that being imprisoned is his life now and expressed happiness that five other people had been granted bail.

title: Europe's Different Yardsticks To Judge Events In Venezuela And Ukraine
content: Europe's silence on the nighttime US military raid in Venezuela's capital Caracas that led to the capture of President Nicolas Maduro has drawn criticism over applying different yardsticks to controversial acts by nations.

title: Trinamool vs BJP Over Rs 1,670-Crore Bridge In Bengal's Sagar Island
content: The annual Gangasagar Mela, the world's second-largest human congregation after the Kumbh mela, has become the latest political flashpoint between the ruling Trinamool Congress and the BJP in Bengal.

title: Over 40 Students Ill After Jaundice Outbreak At Odisha Government School
content: Over 40 students were taken ill after a jaundice outbreak at the Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya (JNV) in Odisha's Khurda district, officials said on Monday.

title: Political 'Punch Up' In Karnataka, Meeting Ends In Brawl Between Rivals
content: Chaos marked a key government meeting in Karnataka's Bidar today, as two legislators from rival parties nearly came to blows in front of a state minister.

title: "Records Are Meant To Be Broken": Siddaramaiah Set To Become Karnataka's Longest-Serving Chief Minister
content: Amid the leadership tussle, Siddaramaiah is all set to equal the record of the longest-serving Karnataka Chief Minister, held by D. Devaraj Urs, on Tuesday.

title: How Cowboys wasted one of Dak Prescott's best seasons
content: dak Prescott had surgery for a right hamstring avulsion that ended his 2024 season . it was the third time in five seasons he had missed significant time because of injury . he threw for more than 4,000 yards and had at least 30 touchdown passes .

title: Ranking the best QBs in the transfer portal
content: ESPN's rankings of the top quarterbacks in the transfer portal . the most coveted passers on the board are quickly locking in decisions on their next stop . a year later, it's Indiana, Oregon, Ole Miss and Miami in the college football playoff semifinals .

title: Pistons, Knicks and big questions along the race for the East's top seed
content: the new york Knicks and Detroit Pistons face off as the top two seeds in the Eastern Conference . the two teams have ramped-up expectations for the first time since the series . they are the newly crowned NBA Cup champions, led by the steady Brunson .

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: Tracking coaching changes: Falcons fire Raheem Morris after two seasons
content: the Falcons are the third team to fire their head coach during the 2025 season after the Tennessee Titans and New York Giants also made changes . sources say the team fired Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot after two straight disappointing seasons . their exits came hours after Atlanta wrapped up an 8-9 season with a 19-17 win over the Saints .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
